title: Which is the most unstable uranium isotope? - Quora

response.answer_text: Which is the most unstable uranium isotope? Some of the isotopes of uranium, in descending order by half-life (ascending by radio intensity): U-232: 68.9 yr U-233: 159,200 yr U-234: 245,500 yr U-235: 700,000,000 yr U-236: 23,420,000 yr U-237: 6.75 days U-238: 4,468,000,000 yr U-239: 23.45 minutes The most nstable, then, among those mentioned is U-239. That’s not the final word; many more isotopes of uranium are possible, but which veryt quickly breakdown, which means “more unstable” with the definition we’re using. The one definite is that U-238, the most common isotope of uranium, is the most stable.
Uranium 232 has a 69 year half life. That is why we don’t find that isotope in nature, but only synthesized. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uranium
